dataElement.name: Message Reference
dataElement.description: Consecutive count of messages within the transmission

dataElement.name: Type
dataElement.description: Order Header Identifier

idList.idValue: Order Header

dataElement.name: Version Number
dataElement.description: '9' for this version

dataElement.name: Transaction Code
dataElement.description: Code Values List 2

idList.idValue: Complete transmission of Product Information File with products chained together
Update transmission of Product Information File with products chained together
Complete transmission of Product Information File with products linked together in a hierarchy
Update transmission of Product Information File with products linked together in a hierarchy
Complete transmission of Price Information File from supplier to customer
Update transmission of Price Information File from supplier to customer
Complete transmission of Price Information File sent from customer to supplier
Update transmission of Price Information File sent from customer to supplier
Complete transmission of Customer Information File
Update transmission of Customer Information File
Complete transmission of Location Information File
Update transmission of Location Information File
Complete transmission of Retailer Standing Database File
Update transmission of Retailer Standing Database File
Complete transmission of Retailer Database Report
Update transmission of Retailer Database Report
Proposed Orders = planned orders which will subsequently be confirmed. Usually sent to help a supplier plan production.
Order for goods on approval/inspection = order for goods which may be returned after a period of inspection without being invoiced
Exceptions to Proposed Orders = changes to a previously sent proposed order, which could be made either by the customer or the supplier

Planning Orders = follow Proposed Orders and will subsequently be confirmed by the customer. Used to show all lines with details of quantities required and delivery locations. Intended to give a firm basis for the supplier to plan production and supplies.
Cancelled Orders = used to cancel outstanding orders. These may originate either from the customer, when their requirements have changed, or the supplier if they cannot meet the order
Confirmation of Cancelled Orders = confirms that outstanding orders have been cancelled within the sender's system
Export Order = order placed on UK supplier for delivery overseas
Standing Order = an order for regular supplies, valid over a long term
New Orders = new order for goods and/or services
Order for retained approval goods = retrospective order to cover goods already received on approval/inspection when these are being retained

Order Amendment = contains changes to an outstanding order, such as quantities, prices and delivery dates. To minimise transmission costs, only send the details for the products which have been amended. Use transaction codes 0475 for re=scheduled orders or transaction code 0485 for additional lines. Note that order amendments can rarely be processed automatically.
Order Chaser = used to chase delivery of an outstanding order
Copy Orders = a copy of an order previously sent by EDI or other media.
Confirmation of Order by Ordering Company = used for example when an order is placed by telephone or fax
Mixed Order Types = the file contains a mixture of different types of order. Each order should be processed according to the Order Code given in ORD ORCD.
Re=Scheduled Orders = used to change the delivery date of an order or order line. Only the lines which have been re=scheduled need be sent
Call=Off Orders = request for delivery against a contract, blanket or standing order
Addition to Existing Orders, Existing Requirements Unchanged = additional lines to be added to an outstanding order. Only the new lines need be sent
Order Commitment = a contract to supply, not an instruction to deliver
Complete transmission of Hot Card File
Update transmission of Hot Card File
Delivery = a notification of delivery against an order, containing details of all the lines on the order. Normally produced by the supplier once goods have been picked for that order
Consignment Note = sent by the supplier to the carrier to control the movement of a consignment through the distribution network to the customer
Instruction to Deliver = a request for a delivery to be made
Planned Delivery = used to report the status of a future delivery
Delivery Adjustment = a notification of changes to a delivery, used when amendments are made or requested after a proposed delivery or request to deliver has been sent

Balance = used to notify details of a part delivery when balances are accepted. Only includes those lines which are being delivered, not all the lines on the order, some of which may already have been received.
Proposed Delivery = advance notice of an impending delivery
Warehouse Receipt = notification that goods have been received at a warehouse

Pallet Exchange Note = notification that pallets have been, or are to be exchanged. These may be either full or empty pallets. Used when different types of pallet movements are being recorded (ie mixed file type).
Pallet Control Voucher = control document issued when goods have been delivered on pallets and no empty pallets were available for exchange.
Pallet Issue Note = notification that fresh pallets have been, or are to be issued. May also be used when goods on pallets have been recalled.
Pallet Return Note = notification that pallets have been, or are to be returned
Pallet Transfer Note = record of, or request for transfer of pallets
Pallet Query Note = request for information on the status of pallet movements. Used when no empty pallets or control vouchers were received.
Pallet Return Advice Note = notification that returns have been made
Pallet Ex Factory Movement = record of pallet transfers out of a factory. Pallets may be empty or full.
Pallet Collection Request = request for pallets to be collected/uplifted
Load Collection Request = request for goods to be collected/uplifted
Confirmation of Delivery = confirms the goods and quantities which have been delivered at a location
Confirmation of Despatch = confirms the goods and quantities which have been despatched to a location
Confirmation of Delivery Status Report = confirms the status of a delivery in preparation or transit
Equipment Movement Confirmation = confirms the transfer of an item of equipment

Invoices Only = commercial document (sales invoice) issued by a supplier to a customer listing the goods or services supplied and stating the sum of money due. For ease of reconciliation it is recommended that one invoice relates to one order and/or one delivery. Contains tax details where applicable.
Self Billed Invoices = commercial invoice raised by the customer based on the order placed, delivery received and the contract of supply
Retrospective Self=Billed Invoice = commercial invoice raised by the customer retrospectively
Factored Invoice = commercial invoice sent by a supplier to a factor who will be receiving the payment from the customer
Assigned Debt Invoice. Used by sellers to send an invoice file via EDI to the buyers advising them that the debt has been assigned to the factoring company

Copy Invoice = not for VAT purposes. Raised when copies of an invoice document are sent from one party to another by EDI for information purposes only. The original invoice may have been sent by EDI or on paper.
Provisional invoice, not valid for tax purposes. A periodic consolidated tax invoice must follow (either EDI or paper document).
Credit Claims (News trade) = claim for credit against unsold copies of a newspaper or magazine
Sales Report = not final claim for credit. Report of sales of newspapers and magazines
Utility Bill = commercial invoice for metered services. Contains tax details where applicable.
Copy Bill = not for VAT purposes. Copy of a utility bill previously sent by EDI or other means. For information purposes only.
Utility Credit Note = credit notes only

Debit Notes Only = notification of a sum or sums owing, raised by the debtor (customer). Trading partners should agree whether this will contain VAT details, or whether the supplier will subsequently raise a Credit Note as the VAT document.
Credit Notes Only = notification of a sum or sums to be credited. Usually sent by a supplier to a customer
Self Billed Credit Notes = a credit note raised by the customer based on information already known
Retrospective Self=Billed Credit Note = credit note raised by the customer retrospectively
Copy Credit Note = not for VAT purposes. Copy of a credit note sent by EDI or other means for information only
Electronic Funds Transaction
Statement Details Only = list of credits and debits with the outstanding balance, sent either as a report or to request payment from the customer by the supplier
Remittance Details Only = details of the items against which a payment is being made. Sent by the payer to the payee.
Uplift Notification = notification of a an uplift (collection) of goods which is being, or has been made
Planned Uplift = advance notification of an uplift (collection) of goods which is to be made
Uplift Confirmation = confirmation of the items and quantities which are being, or have been, uplifted
Confirmation of Uplift Status Report = report of the status of an uplift (collection) which is being, or is due to be, made
Picking Instructions Only = instructions on what to pick for an order or delivery
Picking Instructions Amendments = change to a picking instruction
Availability Report Only = report of actual or planned stock availability
Stock Snapshot Only = report of current stock holdings, usually sent by the stockholder to a supplier
Stock Adjustment Only = notification of adjustments to stock holdings, usually sent by a third party stockholder (eg a carrier) to the owner of the stock
Product Planning Report = planning report on products held at different locations
Location Planning Report = report for locations holding various products
Acknowledgement that an Order has been received, with no further reference to the original purchase order line details.
Acknowledgement that an Order, with line details as shown, has been received, with no reference as to whether or not the supplier can meets its requirements
Acknowledgement, including expected delivery, for ALL lines ordered.
Acknowledgement, including expected delivery, for SOME lines ordered. Assumes the remaining lines will be, or have been, acknowledged separately. (Not used by EDICUG)

Acknowledgement providing expected delivery information ONLY for those lines where the Supplier cannot meet the requested delivery date(s). Assumes the lines not included will be delivered as requested. (Not used by EDICUG)
Acknowledgement of order not able to be supplied. Query outstanding on customer account. No reference is made to the order line details
Acknowledgement changing details which have previously been advised, eg. change in Date, Quantity, Price, etc. All details for a line must be shown, including those which have not changed
Acknowledgement category NOT defined. Will be used where the supplier's system does not have inbuilt indicators
Acknowledgement that a request to cancel an order has been received and actioned. No reference is made to the order line details.(Not used by EDICUG)
Claims Acknowledgement (News trade) = response to a claim for credit, indicating which claims have been accepted or rejected
Payment Order = instruction on a bank to make a payment to a third party
Debit Advice = notification given by the bank to the payer to confirm that a payment has been, or will be, taken from their account
Credit Advice = notification given by the bank to the payee that a credit payment has been, or will be, made to their account
Exception = report from the bank to the payer that a problem has been identified with a payment
Issues (News trade) = master file showing details of the current issues of a magazine or newspaper, with selling restrictions
Supply and Returns (News trade) = report of the number of copies of an issued newspaper or magazine which have been sold or remain unsold
Dye Order = order for special textile dying and finishing operations
Return Dye Instruction = accompanies the returned dyed and finished items
Complete transmission of Price and Availability Update File
Update transmission of Price and Availability Update File

dataElement.name: Transaction Type
dataElement.description: Code Values List 3

idList.idValue: Order Header

dataElement.name: Supplier's EAN Location Number
dataElement.description: EAN Location number identifying supplier

dataElement.name: Supplier's Identity Allocated by
dataElement.description: Supplier's Code as allocated/used by customer

dataElement.name: Supplier's Name
dataElement.description: Supplier's legal name as printed on invoices

dataElement.name: Numeric VAT Registration Number
dataElement.description: Trader's VAT number allocated by HM Customs & Excise

dataElement.name: Alphanumeric VAT Registration
dataElement.description: Government department or non-UK VAT number

dataElement.name: Customer's EAN Location Number
dataElement.description: EAN Location number identifying the customer

dataElement.name: Customer's Identity Allocated by
dataElement.description: Customer's Code as allocated/used by supplier

dataElement.name: Customer's Name
dataElement.description: Customer's registered legal name

dataElement.name: Numeric VAT Registration Number
dataElement.description: Trader's VAT number allocated by HM Customs & Excise

dataElement.name: Alphanumeric VAT Registration
dataElement.description: Government department or non-UK VAT number

dataElement.name: First Level Sequence Number
dataElement.description: Starts at 1 & incremented by 1 for each 1st level repeat

dataElement.name: Code Table Number
dataElement.description: Code Value from code list

dataElement.name: File Generation Number
dataElement.description: This number is sequential, per file type, per trading partner

dataElement.name: File Version Number
dataElement.description: Original (which is always 1) is incremented by 1 for each additional copy created

dataElement.name: File Creation Date
dataElement.description: Date the file is createdFormat: YYMMDD

dataElement.name: File (Reel) Identification
dataElement.description: Reference on the outside of the reel containing the file

dataElement.name: Number of Segments in Message
dataElement.description: Control count of the number of segments comprising message. The count includes the MHD and MTR segments surrounding the message

dataElement.name: Message Reference
dataElement.description: Consecutive count of messages within the transmission

dataElement.name: Type
dataElement.description: Order Details Identifier

idList.idValue: Order Detail

dataElement.name: Version Number
dataElement.description: '9' for this version

dataElement.name: Customer's EAN Location Number
dataElement.description: EAN number identifying the customer's location

dataElement.name: Customer's Own Location Number
dataElement.description: Customer's identity for the location

dataElement.name: Supplier's Identity of Customer's
dataElement.description: Supplier's reference for the customer's location

dataElement.name: Customer's Name
dataElement.description: Customer's registered legal name

dataElement.name: Customer's Order Number
dataElement.description: As allocated by the customer to identify the order

dataElement.name: Supplier's Order Number
dataElement.description: As allocated by the supplier to identify the order

dataElement.name: Date Order Placed by Customer
dataElement.description: Date order placed, which may be date of file.

dataElement.name: Date Order Received by Supplier
dataElement.description: Format: YYMMDD

dataElement.name: Order Classification
dataElement.description: Code Values List 6

idList.idValue: Campaign
Easter
New Release
Request (special customer order for items not usually stocked)
Stock (replenishment order)
Christmas

dataElement.name: Order Code
dataElement.description: Code Values List 7

idList.idValue: Order Amendment
Branch Delivery Order
Cancelled Order
Home Delivery Order
Exception to Proposed Order
Confirmation Order
Standing Order
Order for Retained Approval Goods
Confirmation of Cancelled Order
Lines Cancelled in Amended Order
New Order
Call Off Order
Proposed Order
Re-Scheduled Order
Order for Goods on Approval or Inspection
Order Commitment
Order Chaser
Addition to Existing Order

dataElement.name: Specification Number
dataElement.description: Specification No. to which order relates

dataElement.name: Contract Number
dataElement.description: Contract No. to which order relates

dataElement.name: Earliest Delivery Date
dataElement.description: Date of delivery or earliest date the delivery could take place.Format: YYMMDD

dataElement.name: Latest Delivery Date
dataElement.description: Only present if more than one delivery or when delivery must take place before this date.Format: YYMMDD

dataElement.name: Earliest Time
dataElement.description: Format: HHMM

dataElement.name: Latest Time
dataElement.description: Format: HHMM

dataElement.name: Delivery Instruction Number
dataElement.description: Reference number of pre-defined delivery instructions statement

dataElement.name: First Level Sequence Number
dataElement.description: Starts at 1 & incremented by 1 for each 1st level repeat

dataElement.name: Code Table Number
dataElement.description: Code Value from code list

dataElement.name: First Level Sequence Number
dataElement.description: Starts at 1 and is incremented by 1 for each segment of this type in this message

dataElement.name: EAN-13 Article Number for the Traded
dataElement.description: EAN article number for the unit of trade

dataElement.name: Unit
dataElement.description: Supplier's internal reference (non-EAN) identifying the unit of trade

dataElement.name: Supplier's Code for the Traded Unit
dataElement.description: Code for the traded unit allocated under the alternative (DUN-14) EAN system

dataElement.name: Supplier's EAN Article Number for the Designated Consumer Unit
dataElement.description: EAN number allocated to the retail (POS) unit. (Insert five leading zeros before eight digit codes.)

dataElement.name: Customer's Own Brand EAN Number
dataElement.description: Can be used for 'own label' items allocated an in-store number in a general format. EAN Prefix - 2 dig; customer's number - 5 dig; consumer unit number - 8 dig

dataElement.name: Consumer Units in Traded Unit
dataElement.description: Number of consumer units making up the supplier's traded unit

dataElement.name: Ordering Measure
dataElement.description: Required when an item is ordered as a multiple of a defined measure

dataElement.name: Measure Indicator
dataElement.description: Mnemonic defining the ordering measure, eg. pounds, metres, litres. Code Values List 4. Mandatory if Ordering Measure used

dataElement.name: Cost Price
dataElement.description: Optional field identifying the agreed or expected cost per unit ordered. This is the net cost in pounds ie. after deducting line discounts, etc. but before the application of VAT, of a traded unit or measure as defined by the measure indicator

dataElement.name: Special Price Indicator
dataElement.description: Code Values List 5

idList.idValue: Export
Free
Promotion

dataElement.name: To Follow Indicator
dataElement.description: Code Values List 8

idList.idValue: Not to follow
To follow

dataElement.name: Specification Number
dataElement.description: Specification No. to which line relates

dataElement.name: Contract Number
dataElement.description: Contract No. to which line relates

dataElement.name: First Level Sequence Number
dataElement.description: Takes the value of SEQA in the preceding segment with which this segment is nested

dataElement.name: Second Level Sequence Number
dataElement.description: Starts at 1 & incremented by 1 for each 2nd level repeat

dataElement.name: Code Table Number
dataElement.description: Code Value from code list

dataElement.name: Lines Ordered
dataElement.description: Number of OLD segments for this order

dataElement.name: Number of Segments in Message
dataElement.description: Control count of the number of segments comprising message. The count includes the MHD and MTR segments surrounding the message

dataElement.name: Message Reference
dataElement.description: Consecutive count of messages within the transmission

dataElement.name: Type
dataElement.description: Order Trailer Identifier

dataElement.description: '9' for this Version

dataElement.name: File Total Number of Orders
dataElement.description: Total Number of order details messages in the file

dataElement.name: Number of Segments in Message
dataElement.description: Control count of the number of segments comprising message. The count includes the MHD and MTR segments surrounding the message
